Key Match Events: The Rockets tied the game with an 18-2 run to open the fourth quarter.
Golden State scored the first six points in overtime to make it 125-119.
Aaron Holiday stole the ball from Draymond Green and fouled out a few seconds later.
Tari Eason made two free throws after that to send it to overtime.
Post-Match Reflections: Buddy Hield scored 27 points and the Warriors improved to 5-1 this season without Curry.
The Rockets played much better after halftime but couldnâ€™t close it out to build on consecutive wins at San Antonio and Dallas.
Jonathan Kuminga scored the first two baskets of overtime to make it 123-119.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Warriors led by 31 points in the first half.
Eason led the Rockets with a career-high 27 points.
Andrew Wiggins added 15 points for Golden State in his return after missing two games with a strained back.
Others: The Rockets made just 1 of 12 shots in overtime.
The Warriors led by five before a 3-pointer by Jabari Smith Jr. cut the lead to 119-117 with 15.5 seconds to go in regulation.
